thread.title: 'Dogs Hope to Avenge NSCC Loss in Opener
thread.title_full: 'Dogs Hope to Avenge NSCC Loss in Opener

title: 'Dogs Hope to Avenge NSCC Loss in Opener
text:
'Dogs Hope to Avenge NSCC Loss in Opener 
By Zach Schneider October 7, 2015 Updated Oct 7, 2015 at 6:35 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- The University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) men's hockey team played Bemidji State only once last season, but it was a game that is still weighing heavily on the Bulldogs' minds. 
It was a 4-0 loss at the North Star College Cup, and UMD players plan for things to go differently in this weekend's season opener. 
"We're looking for vengeance," junior forward Alex Iafallo said. "Not to bring it up, but the North Star Cup was a tough loss for us. It's the first game of the season, and we're just going to keep it simple." 
Beating Bemidji State, however, won't be an easy task. 
"They're a tough, hard-working team," junior forward Dominic Toninato said. "They're always going, they play physical, they play well defensively, and they get pucks deep. We've got to be ready to go from the drop of the puck." 
The season-opening series is a home-and-home format for UMD, with Friday's game being played at AMSOIL Arena before the series shifts to Bemidji, Minn. for Saturday. 
Friday's game is scheduled for a 7:07 p.m. start and can be seen in the Northland on the My 9 Sports Network.
